subject: Law
title: Employee Departures and Trade Secrets
description: A 60-second lesson on Employee Departures and Trade Secrets.

hook.text: A top engineer leaves for a competitor. She knows the secret formula. Can her old employer stop her?

buildup.text: Employees often carry trade secrets in their heads. When they leave, the risk of disclosure spikes.

discovery.text: Companies use NDAs, non-competes, and exit interviews to protect secrets during employee transitions.

twist.text: General knowledge and skills belong to the employee. Only specific proprietary information is protectable.

climax.text: The inevitable disclosure doctrine lets courts block employees from roles where they'd inevitably use trade secrets.

punchline.text: You can leave your job. You can't take the secrets with you.

quiz.question: What does the inevitable disclosure doctrine allow?
options: Courts to block roles where trade secrets would inevitably be used
